availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Masonic lodge in Georgetown, Scott County, Kentucky. Chartered August 27, 1807, with Carey L. Clarke its first Master. Had 47 members in 1848. Provisional Governor George Washington Johnson belonged to this lodge. This lodge is still in operation.

bibl.p: Morris, Rob, Grand Master, The History of Freemasonry in Kentucky, in its Relations to the Symbolic Degrees (Louisville, KY: Published by Rob Morris, 1859), 470, https://books.google.com/books?id=HkNfAAAAcAAJ&pg=PA470&dq=masons+%22mt.+vernon+lodge%22+kentucky&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiSuo7SdbVAhUBIMKHd3jAVwQ6AEIMTAC#v=onepage&q=%20%22mt.%20vernon%20lodge%22%20&f=false (accessed 14 Aug 2017).
